TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content: I'm still not entirely convinced that those oceans aren't photoshopped in from real life..
inb4 hired by Squad together with Ryan when they finally decide to add clouds to the game. Those oceans dude, seriously that looks amazing.

> 
> That eyecandy is delicious! Seriously, it looks like a whole new game. I hope my video card is up to the challenge.
> Are the clouds in the first pic from EVE or part of Scatterer?

The clouds in the first pic are indeed from EVE.

> 
> I'm still not entirely convinced that those oceans aren't photoshopped in from real life..

You'll be convinced enough when they're running on your install.

Seriously though dude, issue #2 on the known issues. scatterer is not currently OpenGL friendly, artifacts are common and will be common for a while.

 Holy mother of Kerbal, that looks absolutely awesome.

Blocked by clouds, no.

>

It'll take a real miracle to integrate the terrain renderer or the trees but with everything else I'd say we have about 40-50% of it.

I'm using a stack of graphics mods for ksp, EVE, Interstellar, GEMFX and while scatterer looks fantastic when I'm in the lower atmosphere Kerbin looks much better without scatterer (thanks to interstellar and GEMFX). Is there any way to set scatterer up so the effect fades as you gain altitude? I'd basically like scatterer to be switched off by the time I get to low orbit and to be in full effect by the time I'm in lower atmosphere.

> 
> Blocked by clouds, no.
> Similar reflection from moons is possible but it's not implemented right now.
> 
> It'll take a real miracle to integrate the terrain renderer or the trees but with everything else I'd say we have about 40-50% of it.

If you were magical and suddenly integrated Proland, would there be any substantial benefits from the integration? We have the atmosphere scattering and the water now, do we really need the trees or should we just improve the current scatter? I'm curious about your opinion.

> 
> If you were magical and suddenly integrated Proland, would there be any substantial benefits from the integration? We have the atmosphere scattering and the water now, do we really need the trees or should we just improve the current scatter? I'm curious about your opinion.

The current terrain is rather unnatural so having a better terrain generator would definitely help a lot, also, the trees and forests would take kerbin to a completely new level so yes, there'd be substantial benefits from the integration. Keep in mind the water isn't ready yet though, it still has huge issues.

> 
> I'm using a stack of graphics mods for ksp, EVE, Interstellar, GEMFX and while scatterer looks fantastic when I'm in the lower atmosphere Kerbin looks much better without scatterer (thanks to interstellar and GEMFX). Is there any way to set scatterer up so the effect fades as you gain altitude? I'd basically like scatterer to be switched off by the time I get to low orbit and to be in full effect by the time I'm in lower atmosphere.

There isn't one right now but there will be a setting in the next version to do that.
